description: Students study the contemporary American family as it meets the challenge of a changing
social world. The primary objective is to enlarge both personal and intellectual
understanding of the complex issues facing families.  Using the range of behavioral
sciences concerned with family life, students study the interaction of individuals within
families and families within society.  Primary emphasis is on theories and practice of
family communication. Offered each semester. Counts toward American
studies major, family studies and educational studies concentrations, and women's and gender
